messageBody:
I agree with Vladimir. This even makes it easy when moving (or consulting)
from company to company. More and more companies are using Junit, thus you
save the time needed to learn yet-another-unit-testing-framework when moving
to a new place. You also get the benefit of being able to use third party
extensions written for junit (see http://junit.org) . You also can later on
use commercial tool and they will (probably) be able to run your junit
tests.

mathieu

----- Original Message -----
From: Vladimir Bossicard
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, April 17, 2002 12:42 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] Junit's Importance


> Can someone tell me the real advantages of using Junit over the
> individual's own Unit testing of the Java Code written by him.


The main advantage of using JUnit (or any other testing tool) is that
you set a standard. In an organization, each developer has his own way
of testing things; if you're maintaining a code you haven't written, you
must first understand the tests that have been written before adding
yours. With JUnit, everyone shares the same framework to execute the tests.

The goal is not to write tests, but to write your application so keep
the tests simple.

-Vladimir
